message.content: This question requires knowledge about the effects of sound waves at certain frequencies. Playing music at a certain frequency can create vibrations that match the natural frequency of a glass, causing it to shatter. This phenomenon is known as resonance. Option (B) is incorrect because playing music at a certain frequency does not necessarily send sound outside. Option (C) is unrelated to the effects of sound waves. Option (D) is also unrelated to the effects of sound waves.

This question requires knowledge about the physics of sound and resonance. When a sound is played at a certain frequency, it can cause an object to vibrate at its resonant frequency. If the intensity of the vibrations is strong enough, it can cause the object to shatter. This phenomenon is called resonance. Option (B) is incorrect because playing music at a certain frequency does not make the sound escape outside. Option (C) is incorrect because sound waves do not directly interact with our teeth. Option (D) is incorrect because playing music at a certain frequency does not crack mirrors.
